intro: Galaxia pedunculata, commonly known as the redstem galaxia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white to pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Galaxia pedunculata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
